com.pilot.jword
Class JWordEditorKit

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.text.EditorKit
      javax.swing.text.DefaultEditorKit
          javax.swing.text.StyledEditorKit
              javax.swing.text.rtf.RTFEditorKit
                  com.pilot.jword.JWordEditorKit
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class JWordEditorKit
extends javax.swing.text.rtf.RTFEditorKit

This is the implementation of RTF editing functionality. Written instead of default RTFEditorKit.

See Also:
Serialized Form

          Places a tab character into the document.

getInputAttributes

public javax.swing.text.MutableAttributeSet getInputAttributes()
Gets the input attributes for the pane. When the caret moves and there is no selection, the input attributes are automatically mutated to reflect the character attributes of the current caret location. The styled editing actions use the input attributes to carry out their actions.

Overrides:
getInputAttributes in class javax.swing.text.StyledEditorKit
Returns:
the attribute set

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Create a copy of the editor kit. This allows an implementation to serve as a prototype for others, so that they can be quickly created.

Overrides:
clone in class javax.swing.text.StyledEditorKit
Returns:

getContentType

public java.lang.String getContentType()
Get the MIME type of the data that this kit represents support for. This kit supports the type text/rtf.

Overrides:

                throws java.io.IOException,
                       javax.swing.text.BadLocationException,
                       java.awt.print.PrinterException
Write content from a document to the given file as XSL-FO. The out can then be used to produce PDF, with a FO processor.

Parameters:
writer - writer
doc - the document to save
Throws:
java.io.IOException - IO related exception
javax.swing.text.BadLocationException - given position is not valid
java.awt.print.PrinterException

              throws java.io.IOException,
                     javax.swing.text.BadLocationException,
                     java.awt.print.PrinterException

                     JWordDocument doc)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,

                     PDFException

writeXHTML

public void writeXHTML(java.lang.String fileName,
                       JWordDocument doc,
                       int svgOption,
                       int wmfOption,
                       int equationOption,
                       int dpi,
                       int imageDpi,
                       boolean useObjectTagForSvg)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
Write content from a document to the given file as XHTML

Parameters:
fileName - file name
doc - the document
svgOption - option for SVG images @see XHTMLWriter
wmfOption - option for WMF/WMF images @see XHTMLWriter
equationOption - option for equations @see XHTMLWriter
dpi - DPI for vector to bitmap conversions
useObjectTagForSvg - use
